attributes.action: bring the civil service out of the “dark ages” and away from the Monday to Friday 9 – 5 work day (so called bank hours), and into line with the private sector working week.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
To away from the Mon to Fri 9–5 work day (bank hours), and into line with the private sector week.

A office worker losses 4 mins of work time when distracted by a phone call. How much time is lost when the same worker has to take an hour or more off to see a member of the civil service because of there working hours.

To help the UK’s industry in reducing lost working time, change the civil service’s working week to include Sat mornings and a morning and afternoon shift system, 7am – 3pm and 3pm – 11pm. 

The shift system and the Sat morning shift, will allow normal workers in the private sector to visit a civil service worker with out losing time from work. This will also allow workers who do not have fixed working week hours, like truck drivers who start at 5am and finish at 8pm, to sort out issues like tax ect, with out having to make plans around there work commitments.

The shift system would also increases the amount of work being done by the civil service.

The morning and afternoon shift system will also help with road congestion as it will move people who work in the civil service from being on the road just before 9am and just after 5pm, to earlier and later in the day.
